title: [K-12] Online Mathematics Education in the Pandemic Era: Exploring Effective Teaching Methods through a Phenomenological Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level understanding of basic mathematical concepts
context.additional_context: A real-time online mathematics education course conducted in a smartphone-centered limited-technology environment, aimed at strengthening vocational foundational skills while adapting to post-pandemic educational changes

learning_goals: Learners can explain the process of solving math problems using online tools (Zoom, mobile calculators, etc.)
Learners can diagnose their level of understanding through formative assessments and develop improvement plans
Learners can propose strategies to collaboratively solve math problems with peers in resource-constrained technological environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
